00021 #ifndef ITERATOR_H_

00033 S_CREATE_EXCEPTION(IteratorException);
00034 
00049 template<class T, class I>
00050 class ForwardIterator : public Object {
00051 public:
00052     typedef std::forward_iterator_tag iterator_category;
00053     typedef T value_type;
00054     typedef ptrdiff_t difference_type;
00055     typedef T* pointer;
00056     typedef T& reference;
00057     typedef ForwardIterator<T, I> self_type;
00058 public:
00059     // Implementation of the required functions in terms of the overridable
00060     // functions
00061 
00062     ForwardIterator(bool begin = false) : _end_reached_(!begin) {
00063     }
00064 
00065     ForwardIterator(const ForwardIterator<T, I>& other) :
00066     _end_reached_(other._end_reached_) {
00067     }
00068 
00069     virtual ~ForwardIterator() {
00070     }
00071 
00072     reference operator*() {
00073         if (_end_reached_) sthrow(IteratorException,
00074                 "Tried to dereference an beyond-end iterator");
00075         return current();
00076     }
00077 
00078     const reference operator*() const {
00079         if (_end_reached_) sthrow(IteratorException,
00080                 "Tried to dereference an beyond-end iterator");
00081         return current();
00082     }
00083 
00084     reference operator->() {
00085         if (_end_reached_) sthrow(IteratorException,
00086                 "Tried to dereference an beyond-end iterator");
00087         return current();
00088     }
00089 
00090     const reference operator->() const {
00091         if (_end_reached_) sthrow(IteratorException,
00092                 "Tried to dereference an beyond-end iterator");
00093         return current();
00094     }
00095 
00096     const I & operator++() const {
00097         if (_end_reached_) sthrow(IteratorException, "End of iterator");
00098         else if (!hasNext()) {
00099             _end_reached_ = true;
00100             return *static_cast<I*> (this);
00101         } else {
00102             next();
00103             return *static_cast<I*> (this);
00104         }
00105     }
00106 
00107     I & operator++() {
00108         if (_end_reached_) sthrow(IteratorException, "End of iterator");
00109         else if (!hasNext()) {
00110             _end_reached_ = true;
00111             return *static_cast<I*> (this);
00112         } else {
00113             next();
00114             return *static_cast<I*> (this);
00115         }
00116     }
00117 
00118     const I operator++(int) const {
00119         I toReturn(*static_cast<I*> (this));
00120         if (_end_reached_) sthrow(IteratorException, "End of iterator");
00121         else if (!hasNext()) {
00122             _end_reached_ = true;
00123             return toReturn;
00124         } else {
00125             next();
00126             return toReturn;
00127         }
00128     }
00129 
00130     I operator++(int) {
00131         I toReturn(*static_cast<I*> (this));
00132         if (_end_reached_) sthrow(IteratorException, "End of iterator");
00133         else if (!hasNext()) {
00134             _end_reached_ = true;
00135             return toReturn;
00136         } else {
00137             next();
00138             return toReturn;
00139         }
00140     }
00141 
00142     virtual bool operator==(const I& other) const {
00143         return (_end_reached_ == other._end_reached_) && equals(other);
00144     }
00145 
00146     bool operator!=(const ForwardIterator<T, I>& other) const {
00147         return !(*this == other);
00148     }
00149     void construct(bool begin, void* obj) {
00150         construct(begin,obj);
00151     }
00152 
00153 public:
00154     // Overridable functions
00161     virtual reference current() const = 0;
00167     virtual void next() const = 0;
00175     virtual bool hasNext() const = 0;
00184     virtual bool equals(const I& other) const = 0;
00188     mutable bool _end_reached_;
00189 };
00190 
00191 template<class T, class I>
00192 class BidirectionalIterator : public ForwardIterator<T, I> {
00193 public:
00194     typedef std::bidirectional_iterator_tag iterator_category;
00195     typedef ForwardIterator<T, I> super;
00196     typedef BidirectionalIterator<T, I> self_type;
00197 public:
00198 
00199     BidirectionalIterator(bool begin = false) : super(begin) {
00200     }
00201 
00202     BidirectionalIterator(const BidirectionalIterator<T, I>& other) :
00203     ForwardIterator<T, I>(other) {
00204     }
00205 
00206     I & operator--() {
00207         if (super::_end_reached_) {
00208             super::_end_reached_ = false;
00209             return *static_cast<I*> (this);
00210         } else if (!hasPrevious()) {
00211             sthrow(IteratorException, "Begin of iterator");
00212         } else {
00213             previous();
00214             return *static_cast<I*> (this);
00215         }
00216     }
00217 
00218     const I & operator--() const {
00219         if (super::_end_reached_) {
00220             super::_end_reached_ = false;
00221             return *static_cast<I*> (this);
00222         } else if (!hasPrevious()) {
00223             sthrow(IteratorException, "Begin of iterator");
00224         } else {
00225             previous();
00226             return *static_cast<I*> (this);
00227         }
00228     }
00229 
00230     I operator--(int) {
00231         I toReturn(*static_cast<I*> (this));
00232         if (super::_end_reached_) {
00233             super::_end_reached_ = false;
00234             return toReturn;
00235         } else if (!hasPrevious()) {
00236             sthrow(IteratorException, "Begin of iterator");
00237         } else {
00238             previous();
00239             return toReturn;
00240         }
00241     }
00242 
00243     const I operator--(int) const {
00244         I toReturn(*static_cast<I*> (this));
00245         if (super::_end_reached_) {
00246             super::_end_reached_ = false;
00247             return toReturn;
00248         } else if (!hasPrevious()) {
00249             sthrow(IteratorException, "Begin of iterator");
00250         } else {
00251             previous();
00252             return toReturn;
00253         }
00254     }
00255 
00256     virtual bool operator==(const I& other) const {
00257         return ((super::_end_reached_ == other._end_reached_) ||
00258                 (hasPrevious() == other.hasPrevious()))
00259                 && super::operator==(other);
00260     }
00261 public:
00262     virtual bool hasPrevious() const = 0;
00263     virtual void previous() const = 0;
00264 };
00265 
00266 template<class T, class I>
00267 class RandomAccessIterator : public BidirectionalIterator<T, I> {
00268 public:
00269     typedef std::random_access_iterator_tag iterator_category;
00270     typedef BidirectionalIterator<T, I> super;
00271     typedef RandomAccessIterator<T, I> self_type;
00272 public:
00273 
00274     RandomAccessIterator(bool begin = false) : super(begin) {}
00275 
00276     RandomAccessIterator(const self_type& other) :
00277         super(other) {
00278     }
00279 
00280     I & operator+=(unsigned int i) {
00281         ptrdiff_t diff = i;
00282         if (i >= 0) while (diff--) ++(*this);
00283         else while (diff++) --(*this);
00284         return *static_cast<I*>(this);
00285     }
00286 
00287     const I & operator+=(unsigned int i) const {
00288         ptrdiff_t diff = i;
00289         if (i >= 0) while (diff--) ++(*this);
00290         else while (diff++) --(*this);
00291         return *static_cast<const I*>(this);
00292     }
00293 
00294     I & operator-=(unsigned int i) {
00295         return *static_cast<I*>(&(*this += -i));
00296     }
00297 
00298     const I & operator-=(unsigned int i) const {
00299         return &*static_cast<I*>(&(*this += -i));
00300     }
00301 
00302     const I operator+(unsigned int i) const {
00303         I toReturn(*static_cast<const I*>(this));
00304         return toReturn += i;
00305     }
00306 
00307     I operator-(unsigned int i) {
00308         return *static_cast<I*>(&(*this + -i));
00309     }
00310 
00311     ptrdiff_t operator-(const I& other) const {
00312         if (*this > other) return this->currentIndex() - other.currentIndex();
00313         else return other.currentIndex() - this->currentIndex();
00314     }
00315 
00316     const typename super::reference operator[](unsigned int offset) const {
00317         return *(*this +offset);
00318     }
00319 
00320     typename super::reference operator[](unsigned int offset) {
00321         return *(*this +offset);
00322     }
00323 
00324     bool operator>(const I& other) const {
00325         return this->currentIndex() > other.currentIndex();
00326     }
00327 
00328     bool operator<(const I& other) const {
00329         return this->currentIndex() < other.currentIndex();
00330     }
00331 
00332     bool operator>=(const I& other) const {
00333 
00334         return this->currentIndex() >= other.currentIndex();
00335     }
00336 
00337     bool operator<=(const I& other) const {
00338         return this->currentIndex() <= other.currentIndex();
00339     }
00340 
00341 public:
00342     virtual idx_t currentIndex() const = 0;
00343     virtual size_t length() const = 0;
00344 };
00345 
00346 template<class T, class I>
00347 I operator+(unsigned int i, const I itr) {
00348     return itr + i;
00349 }
00350 
00357 template<class Iter>
00358 class SylphIterator : public virtual Object {
00359 public:
00360 
00368     inline SylphIterator(Iter & it) : itr(it) {
00369     }
00370 
00374     inline virtual ~SylphIterator() {
00375     }
00376 
00381     virtual bool hasNext() const {
00382         return itr.hasNext();
00383     }
00384 
00391     virtual const typename Iter::reference next() const {
00392         typename Iter::reference toReturn = *itr;
00393         ++itr;
00394         return toReturn;
00395     }
00396 
00403     virtual bool hasPrevious() const {
00404         return itr.hasPrevious();
00405     }
00406 
00415     virtual const typename Iter::reference previous() const {
00416         --itr;
00417         return *itr;
00418     }
00419 
00427     virtual void front() const {
00428         while (itr.hasPrevious()) --itr;
00429     }
00430 
00439     virtual void back() const {
00440         while (itr.hasNext()) ++itr;
00441     }
00442 
00450     virtual std::idx_t nextIndex() const {
00451         return itr.currentIndex();
00452     }
00453 
00461     virtual std::idx_t previousIndex() const {
00462         return itr.currentIndex() - 1;
00463     }
00464 
00470     virtual void set(typename Iter::reference t) {
00471         *itr = t;
00472     }
00473 
00477     const typename Iter::reference operator++() const {
00478         return next();
00479     }
00480 
00484     const typename Iter::reference operator--() const {
00485         return previous();
00486     }
00487 
00492     const typename Iter::reference operator++(int) const {
00493         return next();
00494     }
00495 
00500     const typename Iter::reference operator--(int) const {
00501         return previous();
00502     }
00503 private:
00504     Iter itr;
00505 };
00506 
00507 template<class Collection>
00508 const SylphIterator<typename Collection::const_iterator> SylphItr(
00509 const Collection& col) {
00510     return SylphIterator<typename Collection::const_iterator > (col.begin());
00511 }
00512 
00513 template<class Collection>
00514 SylphIterator<typename Collection::iterator> SylphMitr(Collection & col) {
00515     return SylphIterator<typename Collection::iterator > (col.begin());
00516 }
